title: Tabular values of  integral based on derivative

content.question: If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B72@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for all real numbers x and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mn>7</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4151@</annotation> </semantics> </math> which of the following could be a table of values for the function <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8qacaWGMbaaaa@36FF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

choices.label: The answer choices are tables of values for ordered pairs of x and f of x.  a) The ordered pairs are (4,-4), (5,-3) and (7,0).
The answer choices are tables of values for ordered pairs of x and f of x.  b) The ordered pairs are (4,-4), (5,-2) and (7,5).
The answer choices are tables of values for ordered pairs of x and f of x.  c) The ordered pairs are (4,-4), (5,6) and (7,3).  c) The ordered pairs are (4,-4), (5,6) and (7,3).
The answer choices are tables of values for ordered pairs of x and f of x.  d) The ordered pairs are (4,0), (5,0) and (7,0).
The answer choices are tables of values for ordered pairs of x and f of x.  e) The ordered pairs are (4,0), (5,4) and (7,6).

content.answer: The answer choices are tables of values for ordered pairs of x and f of x.  b) The ordered pairs are (4,-4), (5,-2) and (7,5).

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
